video.title: Music Production with FL Studio – Full Tutorial for Beginners
video.description:
Lean how to use FL Studio to produce music in this complete course for beginners. FL Studio is a complete software music production environment. It features a graphical user interface with a pattern-based music sequencer.

Tristan Willcox developed this course. You can email him at nebuloustdg@gmail.com

🔗 FL Studio: https://www.image-line.com/

Sample Packs: 
🔗 https://cymatics.fm/
🔗 https://samples.landr.com/
🔗 https://sound-effects.bbcrewind.co.uk/
🔗 https://samplefocus.com/samples/arabian-vocal-melody-dramatic
🔗 https://splice.com/

⭐️ Contents ⭐️
(0:00:00) Chapter 1: Virtual Instruments 
(0:04:35) Chapter 2: Melodies and Chords 
(0:30:52) Chapter 3: Using Patterns 
(0:36:40) Chapter 4: Using Samples
(0:47:02) Chapter 5: Layering and Arranging
(1:00:12) Chapter 6: Leveling
(1:05:54) Chapter 7: Adding to the song
(1:42:55) Chapter 8: Mixing + FX
(1:58:21) Chapter 9: Automation
(2:07:07) Chapter 10: Mastering + Exporting

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Nattira Maneerat
👾 Heather Wcislo
👾 Serhiy Kalinets
👾 Erdeniz Unvan
👾 Justin Hual
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 Otis Morgan

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Z Dax
topLevelComment.text:
I was excited for this, watched the whole video then installed the software but then actually trying to get this software to work is a pain in the ass.  It says i need to unlock the fL, unlock by signing in, *how do you make an account?* By buying software packs of course.  The help page opens a new tab for every search and every help page assumes you have access to the software. 
In a loop of : sign in with account, can't sign in because no signup for account, need to purchase stuff for free trial.

what a waste of time.

replies.author: Z Dax
replies.text: @Tristan Willcox Thank you for replying and the offer, but I have decided to move on to my other projects. Thank you for this video and hope many others find it helpful.

replies.author: Tristan Willcox
replies.text: Im so sorry to hear that this happened! I can assure you the software is completely free to use in its trial state.  If you would like to reach out to me at my email I could try to help you get it working.

replies.author: Tristan Willcox
replies.text: Sure! any you would recommend? Always looking for something new to learn. The final result isnt something im super proud of but considering i had to make a track with limited time and pretending as if i had never used the software before i think it turned out ok.  Obviously this product isnt representative of work i would give a client but representative of what i think someone who opened FL for the first time in there life is capable of making. hopefully, that makes sense.

topLevelComment.author: Aleksandar Ivanov

This is an unexpected video, but I thoroughly support it 😁
I've used FL Studio for more than 20 years (first 12 years to a professional level, recent years mostly for fun) ever since it was a basic loop station called Fruity Loops with barely any capabilities. I was about 10 years old when I got a demo version from one of those PC magazines with CDs in them and got instantly hooked on making beats!

topLevelComment.author: syaX0
topLevelComment.text: I just started this video so I don't know if this was mentioned, but is there a way to see the notes on one pattern (lets say its drums) while using another pattern (piano or something) while using the piano roll?

replies.author: Omor Jay
replies.text: @Tristan Willcox you did mention it.

replies.author: Tristan Willcox
replies.text:
Your right, i dont think i mentioned this, there is a way to do this, its called "ghost channels" essentially when you change settings in the piano roll in the top left corner there is a tiny arrow, you will click that, navigate to "view" and enable ghost channels, this will allow the notes from a seperate instrument in the same pattern to appear. 

Now if you mean if you can see notes from a seperate pattern sadly there is no way to do this. That would be a nice feature though.

topLevelComment.author: Grabatar
topLevelComment.text:
Just be aware of the free version (Trial version) limitations.
Loved this software as a teenager so worth trying again :).

"What's FL Studio TRIAL mode?
FL Studio TRIAL is functionally equivalent to the FL Studio All Plugins Edition. If you are using trial mode there is only one limitation - Projects can be saved but can't be opened again until FL Studio is purchased and unlocked. "

So you can follow along with this guide, just dont close the app/computer until you done with your project :).

Talking fast but not super fast is a plus for me!

To slow and its just "get to the end of sentence already", and speeding it up makes the listening experience bad often. 

Totes doing this now.
